label: Slack
description: Slack communication and collaboration tools for sending messages, managing channels, and interacting with workspaces.
summary:
The Arcade Slack toolkit provides tools for interacting with Slack workspaces. Build agents and AI apps that can:

- Send and manage messages in channels and DMs
- Create, archive, and manage channels
- List and search workspace members
- React to messages with emoji
- Upload and share files

tools.name: SendMessage
tools.description: Send a message to a Slack channel or direct message. Supports rich text formatting with blocks.

parameters.name: channel_id
parameters.description: The ID of the channel or conversation to send the message to

parameters.name: text
parameters.description: The message text. Supports Slack's mrkdwn formatting

parameters.name: thread_ts
parameters.description: Timestamp of the parent message to reply in thread

output.description: Message send confirmation with timestamp and channel

documentationChunks.content: To get the `channel_id`, use the `ListChannels` tool or find it in the channel details in Slack (right-click channel > View channel details > scroll to bottom).
documentationChunks.title: Finding Channel IDs

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: ListChannels
tools.description: List public and private channels in the workspace that the authenticated user has access to.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of channels to return (default 100, max 1000)

parameters.name: types
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of channel types to include

output.description: List of channel objects with id, name, and metadata

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: AddReaction
tools.description: Add an emoji reaction to a message in Slack.

parameters.name: channel_id
parameters.description: The ID of the channel containing the message

parameters.name: timestamp
parameters.description: The timestamp of the message to react to

parameters.name: emoji
parameters.description: The emoji name without colons (e.g., 'thumbsup' not ':thumbsup:')

output.description: Confirmation of the reaction being added

documentationChunks.content: Slack rate limits vary by method. Most methods allow 1+ request per second, but some (like `chat.postMessage`) are limited to 1 request per second per channel. Implement appropriate rate limiting in your application.
documentationChunks.title: Rate Limits
